body:
Hi Guys

Thanks so much to @adamjstewart for helping out with #4219!

In now have albacore installed outside my fork of Spack.  However, it's not loading all dependencies:

```
[root@node103 spack]# spack activate ont-albacore
==> Activated extension py-six@1.10.0%gcc@6.3.0 arch=linux-rhel6-x86_64 /2uxwssj for python@3.5.2+shared~tk~ucs4%gcc@6.3.0
==> Activated extension py-dateutil@2.5.2%gcc@6.3.0 arch=linux-rhel6-x86_64 /rtn7tjh for python@3.5.2+shared~tk~ucs4%gcc@6.3.0
==> Activated extension py-mpi4py@2.0.0%gcc@6.3.0 arch=linux-rhel6-x86_64 /6qawxwt for python@3.5.2+shared~tk~ucs4%gcc@6.3.0
==> Activated extension py-numpy@1.12.1%gcc@6.3.0+blas+lapack arch=linux-rhel6-x86_64 /7f5sdah for python@3.5.2+shared~tk~ucs4%gcc@6.3.0
==> Activated extension py-h5py@2.6.0%gcc@6.3.0+mpi arch=linux-rhel6-x86_64 /flvo3ix for python@3.5.2+shared~tk~ucs4%gcc@6.3.0
==> Activated extension py-ont-fast5-api@0.3.2%gcc@6.3.0 arch=linux-rhel6-x86_64 /nkx3gck for python@3.5.2+shared~tk~ucs4%gcc@6.3.0
==> Activated extension ont-albacore@1.1.0%gcc@6.3.0 arch=linux-rhel6-x86_64 /qcctc3l for python@3.5.2+shared~tk~ucs4%gcc@6.3.0

[root@node103 spack]# read_fast5_basecaller.py                                                                                                                                                                                                
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/pbtech_mounts/softlib001/apps/EL6/spack/opt/spack/linux-rhel6-x86_64/gcc-6.3.0/ont-albacore-1.1.0-qcctc3lgwrt6ooxjv45h4ontjmj6ugno/bin/read_fast5_basecaller.py", line 60, in <module>
    import pkg_resources
```

I then must do:

```
[root@node103 spack]# spack load py-setuptools                                                                                                                                                                                              
[root@node103 spack]# spack load py-pyparsing
[root@node103 spack]# spack load  py-packaging

```

Otherwise each module will be shown as missing when running "read_fast5_basecaller.py"    

The template:
```
    depends_on('python@3.5.0:3.5.999',     type=('build', 'run'))
    depends_on('py-setuptools',     type=('build'))
    depends_on('py-numpy',        type=('build', 'run'))
    depends_on('py-dateutil',        type=('build', 'run'))
    depends_on('py-h5py',        type=('build', 'run'))
    depends_on('py-ont-fast5-api',        type=('build', 'run'))
    depends_on('py-pip',        type=('build'))
```

Though it seems this package actually needs setuptools for running not simply building.  Can anyone else replicate?  Moreover, doing "spack load py-setuptools" did not load dependencies  py-pyparsing and  py-packaging even though I have this set in $SPACK_ROOT/etc/spack/modules.yml which supposidly will override $SPACK_ROOT/etc/spack/defaults/modules.yml and  ~/.spack/modules.yaml:

```
modules:
  enable:
    - tcl
    - dotkit
  tcl:
    ^python:
      autoload: 'direct'
  prefix_inspections:
    bin:
      - PATH
    man:
      - MANPATH
    share/man:
      - MANPATH
    share/aclocal:
      - ACLOCAL_PATH
    lib:
      - LIBRARY_PATH
      - LD_LIBRARY_PATH
    lib64:
      - LIBRARY_PATH
      - LD_LIBRARY_PATH
    include:
      - CPATH
    lib/pkgconfig:
      - PKG_CONFIG_PATH
    lib64/pkgconfig:
      - PKG_CONFIG_PATH
    '':
      - CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH
```

My goal would be for the user to type "spack load ont-albacore" then not have to do anything else.
title: Spack Does Not Load Python Dependencies for Albacore
